headline.main: BRITISH ADVANCE TO GULF OF SIDRA; Patrols Cut Off Axis to West in Libya -- Nazi Divisional General Reported Seized

lead_paragraph: CAIRO, Egypt, Nov. 30 -- British mechanized patrols have advanced nearly 300 miles across the Libyan desert and reached the shore of the Gulf of Sidra at a point below Bengazi and above Agedabia, the British Middle East Command announced today.
abstract: Brit patrols advance across Libya to Gulf of Sidra; destroy Axis land convoys; halt Axis attempt to break through to west, Rezegh-Tobruk region; capture Gen von Ravenstein, other officers and troops; Free French planes bomb German tanks south of Tobruk; Malta has air-raid alarm

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS

snippet: CAIRO, Egypt, Nov. 30 -- British mechanized patrols have advanced nearly 300 miles across the Libyan desert and reached the shore of the Gulf of Sidra at a point below Bengazi and above Agedabia, the British Middle East Command announced today....

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
